1431.56.text:

that the restored reef

1434.20.text:
looks much healthier
than the degraded reef.

1435.97.text:
So it shows
that the
restored reef

1439.97.text:
and lots of different animals
there than the degraded reef.

1442.47.text:
In the restored reef
we saw a blue crab

1444.88.text:
and blue crabs like to eat
oysters,
so it's a good thing

1447.61.text:
because we saw a predator
of the oyster there.

1450.08.text:
(Taylor)
So it was like a buffet for
the predators that were there.

1453.95.text:
Yeah, you don't want to go
to a restaurant with no food!

1456.92.text:
We should show it to Cecily,
see what she thinks.

1461.53.text:
(Cecily) Hi girls, how are
you guys doing this morning?
(SciGirls) Great!

1464.70.text:
So you guys have had some time
to look at the data.

1468.63.text:
Are there any differences
between what we thought

1471.14.text:
was an unhealthy site
and a restored reef?

1473.80.text:
Well yeah, there's actually
a big difference.

1476.01.text:
What can we say
about the restored reef?

1478.78.text:
That it's way healthier
than the degraded reef,

1481.55.text:
So would you say
species diversity
in abundance was higher?

1486.22.text: Do you guys realize what you did

1489.59.text:
over these last few weeks
is amazing.

1493.06.text:
The fact you built something
that can get good data--

1497.16.text:
I already told
a lot of people. [all laugh]

1500.47.text:
The most important
question from me is,
did you guys all have fun?

1506.44.text:
It was wonderful to work with
you girls; you're very talented.

1518.55.text:
My favorite part
of this experience

1522.59.text:
I thought it was really fun
to hear everyone else's ideas

1525.39.text:
and compile it
into one giant robot.

1527.56.text:
Have to remember,
everybody, got it? Remember.

1529.69.text:
(Hunter) I think we had
a really good experiment.

1532.53.text:
We all worked together
really good.

1536.80.text: We had so much fun together

1538.67.text:
and we had such a great time
on the boat,

1541.34.text:
and this whole experience
was just awesome!

1543.11.text:
Having to say good-bye
was really hard.

1544.98.text:
I hope I can stay
in contact with them.

1549.65.text:
Got some clues? Head on
over to the Web and play

1557.62.text:
The eagle has gone
into the water.

1560.06.text:
Then get on down here,
we have a ring to catch.

1567.03.text:
You're not going to break any
records with those balloons, but

1570.50.text:
they're countering the weight
of the Sea Perch perfectly.

1575.87.text:
Thanks Izz, what would
I do without you?

1579.08.text:
[chuckles] Hm, never make a
statue of Lincoln out of bacon?

1582.48.text:
Exactly! What a loss for the
world that would have been.

1589.95.text: I say we duct tape it up.

1617.85.text:
(SciGirl) Ice and snow makes it
sort of dangerous.

1620.75.text:
I think there's a way that we
could improve nonslip footwear.

1624.72.text:
It talks about biopmimicry,
so it's life copying.

1627.73.text:
could help with traction.

for palm trees,

1634.80.text: but they're not even from here.

Our question was what kind of

across all fields
